name: Asagi
text: We should be safe here, at least for the moment.
After knocking out the Taimanin that had attacked us, Asagi-san and I (a boar) had moved to a slightly secluded area in the forest.

name: Asagi
text: I must say... you fight pretty well for a boar. I'm impressed.

name: Me
text: I mean, that's more thanks to being a boar...
I had been able to knock out two or three Taimanin by charging at them with the force of a massive boar.
If I were in my normal body, which was not very good at combat, this definitely would not have been possible.

name: Me
text: More importantly, sensei... I mean, Asagi-san, what's going on here!?

name: Me
text: Why did I turn into this stupidly huge boar...!?
I asked Asagi-san since she seemed to know something about my situation.
I had called her "Asagi-san" and not "sensei" since she was much younger than the Asagi-sensei I knew.
She looked at least 10 years younger... It was just like with Sakura, the freeloader at my place from another dimension.

name: Asagi
text: Let's see... to explain it briefly, you're a "scapegoat." A decoy meant to buy time for the real lucky boar to escape, you could say.

name: Me
text: A decoy...?

name: Asagi
text: Yes, a decoy. I don't think you know, but there's a dangerous ritual called the "Rite of the Auspicious Beast."

name: Me
text: Oh! I know about that. If I remember correctly, you have to slay a divine beast summoned from the Otherworld, right?
And by doing so, you would gain the divine beast's immense luck.
The ceremony was only carried out on January 1st, on New Year's Day.

"It was said that once the day ended, the 
auspicious beast would turn inauspicious, bringing great calamity to mankind."
...That was what I had gathered from the old document I had read.

name: Asagi
text: Hmm? You sure know a lot for a boar.

name: Me
text: I-I mean... it's not like I was born a boar...

name: Asagi
text: Haha, sorry, I was just joking. I actually know a little bit about what's going on with you.

name: Me
text: H-Huh...?
Asagi-san giggled and proceeded to tell me what she knew.

name: Asagi
text: Well, you got the gist of the ceremony, right. Summon a divine beast from the Otherworld, and by slaying it you gain the power of its luck.

name: Asagi
text:
But the summoned divine beastー
the lucky beast, doesn't want to die either, so it'll try to run away with everything it has.

name: Asagi
text: That being said, with how it looks, it stands out far too muchー

name: Asagi
text: So apparently it sometimes brings along a "scapegoat" from another dimension as a diversion.

name: Me
text: A-And that's me...!?

name: Asagi
text: I guess so? Unless you've always been a boar.

name: Me
text: Seriously...?
I had nothing to do with it, but had been brought here and turned into a boar.
It was no wonder that this beyond-upsetting and bonkers ceremony was forbidden.
Before I knew it, Asagi-san was looking at me curiously.

name: Me
text: ? What is it, Asagi-san?

name: Asagi
text: You're surprisingly calm. Most people would be more shocked or scoff at the idea of "another dimension."

name: Me
text: I mean, it's not that it doesn't shock me... But, how should I put it, I've had a lot of experiences that lead me to believe things, or should I say traumatic experiences.
I had come back from another dimension thanks to that weird Octo-Guy just the other day.
And if this was another dimension, then it would also explain why Asagi-san here looked so young.

name: Asagi
text: Is that so? But anyway, you don't have to worry.

name: Asagi
text: If we slay Kiyomaro, the real lucky beast, you should return to normalー

name: Asagi
text: And by using the power of his luck, you should be able to return to the dimension you came from.

name: Me
text: Really!?

name: Asagi
text: Yes. But for that, your cooperation is necessary. Could you help me?

name: Me
text: Of course! I mean, there's no way I'm gonna stay in another dimension in this body!
Other dimensions aside, remaining a boar forever would be too horrible.

name: Asagi
text: Then let's begin tracking him right away♪ If anyone, you should be able to sniff out where Kiyomaro's hiding.
